item.title: Report E-2024040117
item.description:
Report E-2024040117

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: IRON MOUNTAIN
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AUSTIN POWDER COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 35025
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 6:55 am on 3/8/2024, Austin Powder drive was 4 miles south of Bismark MO at the intersect of N and NN. He was negotiating a lefthand turn driving a 2019 KW T880, loaded with AN emulsion, and diesel fuel for manufacturing bulk products. The drive swung too wide on a left hand turn and his passenger side went off the pavement. The driver slowed to an almost stop. The passenger side of the truck got stuck in the soft dirt and fell on its side. 20 pounds of AN spilled from one of the bins onto the ground. Roughly 50 gallons of offroad diesel spilled from the truck as well. The truck was put upright, and the AN spill was cleaned up and put into spill buckets and removed from the site. The diesel spill was contained using socks and booms. An environmental company came and removed the affected area at a later date.
